Module Utility Functions Search Algorithms¶

utility_search.backward_propagation(x_position_center, y_position_center, steering_angle, velocity, yaw_angle, inputs, end_time, dt, vehicle_parameter)[source]¶

Backward propagation with kinematic single-track model

Parameters

  • x_position_center (float) – x-position of the vehicle center [m]

  • y_position_center (float) – y-position of the vehicle center [m]

  • steering_angle (float) – steering angle of the vehicle [rad]

  • velocity (float) – velocity of the vehicle [m/s]

  • yaw_angle (float) – yaw angle of the vehicle [rad]

  • inputs (List[float]) – inputs [steering velocity, acceleration] of the vehicle [rad/s, m/s^2]

  • end_time (float) – end time for the backward simulation [s]

  • dt (float) – time step [s]

  • vehicle_parameter (Dict[~KT, ~VT]) – vehicle parameter vector

Return type

Tuple[ndarray, dict]

Returns

right-hand side of differential equations

utility_search.check_feasibility_backward(a_new, v, a_min, a_max, dt, v_max, a_cur, j_min, j_max)[source]¶

Limits vehicle acceleration to maximum/minimum value - considers velocity and jerk limit

Parameters

  • a_new (float) – calculated acceleration to reach goal [m/s^2]

  • v (float) – current velocity of vehicle [m/s]

  • a_min (float) – minimum acceleration of vehicle [m/s^2]

  • a_max (float) – maximum acceleration of vehicle [m/s^2]

  • dt (float) – time step size [s]

  • v_max (float) – maximum possible/allowed velocity of the vehicle [m/s]

  • a_cur (float) – current acceleration of the vehicle [m/s^2]

  • j_min (float) – minimum jerk of the vehicle [m/s^3]

  • j_max (float) – maximum jerk of the vehicle [m/s^3]

Return type

float

Returns

Bounded acceleration as scalar value [m/s^2]

utility_search.init_nodes_forward(rrt_param, acc_vehicle_param, simulation_param, lead_vehicle_param)[source]¶

Initialize list of nodes for forward search

Parameters

  • rrt_param (Dict[~KT, ~VT]) – dictionary with RRT parameters

  • acc_vehicle_param (Dict[~KT, ~VT]) – dictionary with physical parameters of the lead vehicle

  • simulation_param (Dict[~KT, ~VT]) – dictionary with parameters of the simulation environment

  • lead_vehicle_param (Dict[~KT, ~VT]) – dictionary with physical parameters of the lead vehicle

Return type

List[Node]

Returns

list of initial nodes

utility_search.is_valid_final_node(node)[source]¶

Check if unsafe node is in valid range

Parameters

node (Node) – node to validate

Return type

bool

Returns

True or False
